Blog.post: Hey all, I'm here.....typin on my blog. Today, The first thing I did was eat breakfast.....lunch actually. I woke up at the crack of noon as usual. Then I went to my friends' house across the street to work on The SIx Cents. Ask me about it. We almost finished today. 2 People need to die and then we need to go to McDonalds to do the last scene. Also, me, my sis, and my Nazi Grandmother went to eat dinner at Jose's. A really good Mexican restaurant. But on the way out, some psyco mexican dude almost ran me over with his truck. Friggin moron...well, at least im still alive.

Well guys, Today was very boring....like usual. I had to go to (insert horror music here) SCHOOL! NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO! Yeah, but it was only to get a schedual change so it wasnt too bad. So now, I will be taking BCIS next year. Other than that, I went to Danny and Michael's house and worked on the Six Cents. And now I'm Home listening to Monty Python.

Well,I just made this new blog. The last one failed...actually, I forgot the password. But oh well. Yeah, Im bored. In fact, I'll just call that one of my hobbies from now on. Hopefully, people will read this and say, hey, that Stephen guy is so awesome. Yeah, nothing to say. Bye.

Hey there all u school hatin dudes and dudettes! Or at least I assume most of u are. Well We made more videos and SOme other stuff. Some of u really need to see them. SUpposedly tomorrow is an XBOx party with some asians and mormons and asian mormons. Maybe I'll go. Ahmed invited me. Only 3 Days till school. Oh how i will hate life....

So it's the last week before school. The only problem is, I cant do anything until i finish reading "A Seperate Peace" WICH IS A PIECE OF JUNK. I hate that freaking book. I have to read it so I'll know it when we do read it in class. I still dont understand this concept. WHY OH WHY? Anyway, Tell me if you have any classes with me.

aAnd Now, a quote from the great movie Monty Python and the Quest for the Holy Grail: [trumpets] NARRATOR: The Tale of Sir Robin. So, each of the knights went their separate ways. Sir Robin rode north, through the dark forest of Ewing, accompanied by his favourite minstrels. MINSTREL: [singing] Bravely bold Sir Robin rode forth from Camelot. He was not afraid to die, O brave Sir Robin. He was not at all afraid to be killed in nasty ways, Brave, brave, brave, brave Sir Robin! He was not in the least bit scared to be mashed into a pulp, Or to have his eyes gouged out and his elbows broken, To have his kneecaps split and his body burned away And his limbs all hacked and mangled, brave Sir Robin! His head smashed in and his heart cut out And his liver removed and his bowels unplugged And his nostrils raped and his bottom burned off And his... SIR ROBIN: That's-- that's, uh-- that's enough music for now, lads. Heh. Looks like there's dirty work afoot. I love this movie.....ah......

THE SIX CENTS IS NOW COMPLETE! MUAHAHAHAHA!!!!! but you know, its not that scary. All but one part that is actually theatre worthy. Come over and see it. If you read this tell me. Well arrange something.
